summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Collection [Blu-ray]
Review Date: 2013/12/25
Store: Josh Stewart  (Actor),     Emma Fitzpatrick  (Actor),     Marcus Dunstan  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
Product Description: ["When Elena is talked into attending an underground warehouse party with her friends, she finds herself caught in a nightmarish trap where the revelers are mowed, sliced and crushed to death by a macabre series of contraptions operated by a masked psychopath. When the grisly massacre is over, Elena is the only survivor. But before she can escape, she is locked in a trunk and transported to an unknown location. Fortunately for Elena, one man; Arkin, knows exactly where she's headed, having just escaped from there with his life and sanity barely intact. Elenas wealthy father hires a crack team of mercenaries to force Arkin to lead them to the killers lair. But even these hardened warriors are not prepared for what they encounter: an abandoned hotel turned torture chamber, rigged with deadly traps and filled with mangled corpses. Can Arkin and the team get to Elena before she too becomes part of his gruesome collection?"]
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Horror', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Closed-captioned, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Marcus Dunstan, Tim Griffin, Josh Stewart, Lee Tergesen, Emma Fitzpatrick, Christopher McDonald', 'Language': 'English, Spanish', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 22 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '26346586', 'Director': 'Marcus Dunstan', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Closed-captioned, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 22 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 26, 2013', 'Actors': 'Josh Stewart, Emma Fitzpatrick, Christopher McDonald, Lee Tergesen, Tim Griffin', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I love this movie. I had seen the first one a good while back & didn't know there was a sequel. This sequel gave you everything & more.
Review Title: Amazing Movie
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: 'Night, Mother
Review Date: 2013/12/25
Store: Sissy Spacek  (Actor),     Anne Bancroft  (Actor),     Tom Moore  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
Product Description: ["Sissy Spacek and Anne Bancroft star in ‘Night Mother, a taut, emotional study about a mother's attempt to stop her distraught daughter from committing suicide. Adapted from the Pulitzer Prize-winning play by author Marsha Norman, the moving production casts Spacek as epileptic with a failed marriage and a delinquent son who decides to take control the only way she can - by taking her own life. Bancroft, as the widowed mother with whom she lives, is oblivious to her daughter's depression until she becomes frightfully aware of her plans. The give-and-take between Spacek and Bancroft makes for a searing family drama which brings to the surface all the love, resentment and understanding that exists between every parent and child."]
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MHV61114473DVD', 'Director': 'Tom Moore', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 37 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 3, 2010', 'Actors': 'Sissy Spacek, Anne Bancroft, Ed Berke, Carol Robbins, Jennifer Roosendahl', 'Producers': 'Dann Byck, Cheryl Downey, Alan Greisman, David Lancaster, Aaron Spelling', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0)', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Marsha Norman', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}

But he discovers a horrifying secret: The community is slowly becoming a village of vampires. raw_response:
**SUMMARY:**

This individual consistently demonstrates a strong preference for horror and drama films, as seen in their purchase history and ratings, with an average score of around 4.6 to 5.0. The reviews express enthusiasm and satisfaction, suggesting genuine enjoyment for emotional and thrilling narratives, often highlighting specific qualities like gripping storylines and impactful performances. 

Notable themes include a penchant for psychological tension, with frequent mentions of complex character dynamics and high-stakes situations. The individual tends to favor both classic and contemporary titles, indicating a diverse interest in cinematic styles and genres.

Quality is a significant preference; each selection carries a high rating, with many labeled as “must-see” or exceptional, suggesting a discerning taste. Price sensitivity seems minimal given the willingness to seek out hard-to-find films and invest in high-quality formats like Blu-ray. 

Overall, the core preferences are rooted in a deep appreciation for well-crafted horror and drama films, with a focus on story depth, character complexity, and emotional resonance, alongside an inclination towards high-quality formats.

target_interaction.title: An eye opening look into the truth & devastated events.
target_interaction.text: This miniseries was an extremely eye opening look into the terrible tragedy. I remembered when it happened but I had no idea of the devastation that followed. It also answered many questions I had about Chernobyl. I recommend this miniseries to anybody who wants to know or understand the truth & pain that happened. I had to buy it so I could go back & make sure I didn't miss anything.
